item.text: So Darius the king issued orders, and they searched in the archives of the treasury which were deposited there in Babylon.

A scroll was found in the citadel of Ecbatana which is in the province of Media, and it was inscribed as follows:

“Memorandum:

In the <st data-num="02298" class="">first</st> <st data-num="08140" class="">year</st> of <st data-num="03567" class="">his</st> <st data-num="04430" class="">reign</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04430" class="">King</st> <st data-num="03567" class="">Cyrus</st> <st data-num="07761" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="02942" class="">orders</st> concerning the <st data-num="01005" class="">temple</st> of <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st> in <st data-num="03390" class="">Jerusalem</st>:<n id="2" /> ‘Let the <st data-num="01005" class="">temple</st> be <st data-num="01124" class="">rebuilt</st> as a <st data-num="0870" class="">place</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">where</st> <st data-num="01685" class="">sacrifices</st> are <st data-num="01684" class="">offered</st>. Let its <st data-num="0787" class="">foundations</st> be <st data-num="05446" class="">set in place</st>.<n id="3" /> Its <st data-num="07314" class="">height</st> is to be <st data-num="08361" class="">90</st> <st data-num="0521" class="">feet</st> and its <st data-num="06613" class="">width</st> <st data-num="08361" class="">90</st> <st data-num="0521" class="">feet</st>,<n id="4" />

with <st data-num="08532" class="">three</st> <st data-num="05073" class="">layers</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> <st data-num="01560" class="">large</st> <st data-num="069" class="">stones</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="02298" class="">one</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05073" class="">layer</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> <st data-num="0636" class="">timber</st>. The <st data-num="05313" class="">expense</st> is to be <st data-num="03052" class="">subsidized</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="04481" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01005" class="">treasury</st>.<n id="4" />

Furthermore, let the gold and silver vessels of the temple of God, which Nebuchadnezzar brought from the temple in Jerusalem and carried to Babylon, be returned and brought to their proper place in the temple in Jerusalem. Let them be deposited in the temple of God.’
“Now Tattenai governor of Trans-Euphrates, Shethar-Bozenai, and their colleagues, the officials of Trans-Euphrates—all of you stay far away from there.
Leave the work on this temple of God alone. Let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews rebuild this temple of God in its proper place.

“I also hereby issue orders as to what you are to do with those elders of the Jews in order to rebuild this temple of God. From the royal treasury, from the taxes of Trans-Euphrates, the complete costs are to be given to these men so that there may be no interruption of the work.

<st data-num="04101" class="">Whatever</st> is <st data-num="02818" class="">needed</st>—whether <st data-num="01123 08450">oxen</st> or <st data-num="01798" class="">rams</st> or <st data-num="0563" class="">lambs</st> for <st data-num="05928" class="">burnt offerings</st> for the <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st> of <st data-num="08065" class="">heaven</st> or <st data-num="02591" class="">wheat</st> or <st data-num="04416" class="">salt</st> or <st data-num="02562" class="">wine</st> or <st data-num="04887" class="">oil</st>, as <st data-num="03983" class="">required</st> by<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03549" class="">priests</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">who</st> are in <st data-num="03390" class="">Jerusalem</st>—must <st data-num="01934" class="">be</st> <st data-num="03052" class="">given</st> to them <st data-num="03118 03118">daily</st> <st data-num="01768 03809">without</st> any <st data-num="07960" class="">neglect</st>,
so that they may be offering incense to the God of heaven and may be praying for the good fortune of the king and his family.

“I hereby give orders that if anyone changes this directive a beam is to be pulled out from his house and he is to be raised up and impaled on it, and his house is to be reduced to a rubbish heap for this indiscretion.

May God who makes his name to reside there overthrow any king or nation who reaches out to cause such change so as to destroy this temple of God in Jerusalem. I, Darius, have given orders. Let them be carried out with precision!”
Then Tattenai governor of Trans-Euphrates, Shethar-Bozenai, and their colleagues acted accordingly—with precision, just as Darius the king had given instructions.

The <st data-num="07868" class="">elders</st> of the <st data-num="03062" class="">Jews</st> continued <st data-num="01124" class="">building</st> and <st data-num="06744" class="">prospering</st>, while at the same time<n id="1" /> <st data-num="02292" class="">Haggai</st> the <st data-num="05029" class="">prophet</st> and <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st> the <st data-num="01247" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05714" class="">Iddo</st> continued <st data-num="05017" class="">prophesying</st>. They <st data-num="01124" class="">built</st> and <st data-num="03635" class="">brought</st> it <st data-num="03635" class="">to completion</st> <st data-num="04481" class="">by</st> the <st data-num="02941" class="">command</st> of the <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st> of <st data-num="03479" class="">Israel</st> and by the <st data-num="02942" class="">command</st> of <st data-num="03567" class="">Cyrus</st> and <st data-num="01868" class="">Darius</st> and <st data-num="0783" class="">Artaxerxes</st> <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="06540" class="">Persia</st>.
They finished this temple on the third day of the month Adar, which is the sixth year of the reign of King Darius.
The people of Israel—the priests, the Levites, and the rest of the exiles—observed the dedication of this temple of God with joy.

For the <st data-num="02597" class="">dedication</st> of <st data-num="01836" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01005" class="">temple</st> of <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st> they <st data-num="07127" class="">offered</st> <st data-num="03969" class="">100</st> <st data-num="08450" class="">bulls</st>, <st data-num="03969" class="">200</st> <st data-num="01798" class="">rams</st>, <st data-num="0703 03969" class="">400</st> <st data-num="0563" class="">lambs</st>, and <st data-num="08648 06236">12</st> <st data-num="06841" class="">male</st> <st data-num="05796" class="">goats</st> for the <st data-num="02402" class="">sin</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">of</st> <st data-num="03606" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03479" class="">Israel</st>, according to the <st data-num="04510" class="">number</st> of the <st data-num="07625" class="">tribes</st> of <st data-num="03479" class="">Israel</st>.

They <st data-num="06966" class="">appointed</st> the <st data-num="03549" class="">priests</st> by their <st data-num="06392" class="">divisions</st> and the <st data-num="03879" class="">Levites</st> by their <st data-num="04255" class="">divisions</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="05673" class="">worship</st> of <st data-num="0426 01768">God</st> at <st data-num="03390" class="">Jerusalem</st>,<n id="1" /> in accord <st data-num="03792" class="">with</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="05609" class="">book</st> of <st data-num="04873" class="">Moses</st>.

<n id="1" /> The <st data-num="01121 01473">exiles</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="06213" class="">observed</st> the <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover</st> on the <st data-num="0702 06240">fourteenth</st> day of the <st data-num="07223" class="">first</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st>.

The <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> and the <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> had <st data-num="02891" class="">purified</st> themselves, <st data-num="0259" class="">every last one</st>,<n id="1" /> and they <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> were <st data-num="02889" class="">ceremonially pure</st>. They <st data-num="07819" class="">sacrificed</st> the <st data-num="06453" class="">Passover lamb</st> for <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01121 01473">exiles</st>, for their <st data-num="0251" class="">colleagues</st><n id="2" /> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>, and for <st data-num="01992" class="">themselves</st>.

The Israelites who were returning from the exile ate it, along with all those who had joined them in separating themselves from the uncleanness of the nations of the land to seek the Lord God of Israel.

They observed the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days with joy, for the Lord had given them joy and had changed the opinion of the king of Assyria toward them so that he assisted them in the work on the temple of God, the God of Israel.
